table-wrap.anchoringText: The assignment in the FDC is also an opportunity to get more experienced professionals to directly collaborate with Subject Matter Experts (SME) therefore build on their skills to eventually become an SME for a particular subject. This interaction between current and potential future SMEs is particularly critical to ensure high level capabilities are preserved within the company in the long term. An example of the composition of a team created to generate one new Field Development Plan for a gas field is presented in Table 1, showing how flexibility in resourcing Study Teams allows younger staff from assets to get in direct contact with experienced coaches in field development or specific technical issues.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Example of composition of an Integrated Study Team in charge of creating a new gas Field Development Plan

formatted-caption.caption-text: Example of composition of an Integrated Study Team in charge of creating a new gas Field Development Plan

table-wrap.anchoringText: An overview of the above mentioned identified challenges faced when developing gas and contaminated fields is provided in Table 2. The table also lists the planned activities and demonstrates the diversity of origins of the expected involved parties that require to be mobilised to address these challenges.
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: List of identified challenges, corresponding ongoing and planned study activities and action parties to support the development of gas and contaminated hydrocarbons fields

formatted-caption.caption-text: List of identified challenges, corresponding ongoing and planned study activities and action parties to support the development of gas and contaminated hydrocarbons fields

tr.td:
• Accurate modelling of the impact of gas condensate drop-out
• Optimization of the condensate field recovery

➢ Laboratory testing
➢ Validation and calibration of modelling techniques.
➢ Large number of dynamic simulations covering the full range of reservoir characteristics, fluid properties and pressures encountered within the company’s portfolio.
Company Experts (Gas Reservoir Engineer) + Collaboration with external providers
• Improvement of the gas recovery from tight reservoir units

➢ Properties of tight units (e.g. saturation, absolute and relative permeabilities)
➢ Identification and testing of a range of subsurface to surface solutions including novel technologies such as Underbalanced Coiled Tubing Drilling, Dreamliners, local compression,...
Company Experts (Gas Reservoir Engineer, Gas Production Technologist, Concept Engineers from study and assets) + Collaboration with external providers
• Optimization of gas wells fraccing and its modelling in dynamic simulators

➢ Full review of historical fraccing data
➢ Specialized geomechanical modelling
➢ Dynamic simulations to best predict impact of fractures on well productivity
Company Experts (Geomechanics, Gas Reservoir Engineer, Gas Production Technologist)

➢ Analysis of trapping mechanisms
➢ Definition of trial
Company Experts (Petrophysicist, Reservoir Engineers, Production Technologist)
Reservoir Engineers with support from the Research Organization of one of the Company’s shareholder
